translation: I believe you must all be very familiar with this clip from the movie Avatar.
transcript: 刚才这个片段相信大家都很熟悉，那是电影《阿凡达》中的片段。

translation: The floating "Hallelujah Mountain" in Avatar, was inspired by the Southern Sky Column of Zhangjiajie.
transcript: 电影《阿凡达》中间的悬浮山，也是哈路路亚山，就是张家界的南天一柱。

translation: The hero, Jake Sully, was sent there in the vanguard of occupying the mountain.
transcript: 里面的主人公杰克·萨利，曾经是我们人类去占领这个山的一个前锋。

translation: However, he later betrayed his fellows and became a warrior for environmental protection.
transcript: 可是他后来背叛了人类，加入了生态环境保护的行列，成了一位生态保护的战士。

translation: So here today I want to share with you my story.
transcript: 那么今天，我到这里来其实也想讲一下我自己的故事。

translation: Seven years ago, I worked as an environmental public relations specialist in a multinational company.
transcript: 七年前，我曾经在一家跨国公司做环境公关。

translation: The company owned more than 6 million mu of forest in China and 17 production bases.
transcript: 这家公司在中国拥有六百多万亩的林地，有十七个生产基地。

translation: It had an annual production capacity of over 7 million tons in pulp and paper and its annual sales could reach 30 billion yuan.
transcript: 每年生产纸浆、造纸大概年产能大概700多万吨，一年的销售额达到300多亿人民币。

translation: My job in this company was to deal with challenges from all sorts of non-governmental organizations featuring environmental protection and those from media concerning the environment.
transcript: 我在这家公司的主要工作是面对各种环境的民间环保组织，乃至媒体的环境方面的挑战。

translation: When I joined this company, it was right under the spotlight for it had planted eucalyptus trees at large scale in Yunnan province and Hainan province, which was strongly protested by NGOs such as Green Peace, Friends of the Earth and Global Village as well as the college student unions of Beijing Forestry University.
transcript: 加入这家公司的时候这个企业正处于风头浪尖上，由于我们公司在云南和海南大面积地种植桉树，所以当时遭到了绿色和平、地球之友、地球村等环保民间组织的强力的反对和抗议，也遭到了北京林业大学很多数高校学生社团的抗议。

translation: Members of the Scientific Exploration and Outdoor Life club of Beijing Forestry University even put on their self-made vests with our trademark and a black cross on it and they boycotted our products in the supermarket.
transcript: 这个北京林业大学山诺会呀，曾经穿上自己制作的马甲，在马甲上打上我们的商标，上面还加了个黑色的叉叉，到商场里去抵制我们产品的销售。

translation: When some women went to buy our products, they would stop them and say, "Please don't buy it. It was made out of paper at the expense of primitive forest, at the cost of our environment."
transcript: 当有一些妇女去买我们的产品的时候，他就拉住她，说:“阿姨你别买这个产品，这个产品是破坏原始森林造出来的纸的，它是破坏环境的。”

translation: All-China Environment Federation(ACEF), the largest NGO featuring environmental protection in China back then, sent their powerful lawyers to Zhejiang to support Zhejiang Hotel Association in their law suit against my employer.
transcript: 当初中国最大的环保民间组织，中华环保联合会还派出了强大的律师团，来到浙江的杭州支持浙江省饭店业协会和我们公司打官司。

translation: My job was to handle those environment-related crises.
transcript: 而我的工作就是来处理这些环境方面的危机。

translation: As a professional manager, I was pretty much an accomplished man.
transcript: 作为一个职业经理人，当时我的工作应该是，怎么讲是有成就的。

translation: I was often invited to lecture in many universities and I also invited lots of students enthusiastic about environmental protection to engage in social practice activities in our forestry bases.
transcript: 我去了很多大学做讲座，我也每年暑假邀请大学的环保的积极分子到我们的林业基地去参加社会实践。

translation: I still remember, in October, 2006, ACEF hosted its Annual Meeting of Sustainable Development.
transcript: 我记得2006年的十月份，中华环保民间组织可持续发展年会在北京召开。

translation: The Scientific Exploration and Outdoor Life society of Beijing Forestry University delivered a speech named Heaven and Hell on behalf of their college counterparts.
transcript: 而北京林业大学山诺会作为高校环保社的代表，当初发言的题目叫《天堂和地狱》。

translation: They used to protest against us.
transcript: 以前他们是反对我们的。

translation: However, after my public relation efforts, they changed their stances.
transcript: 但是在我的公关，在我的这个宣传下，他们转变了立场。

translation: Another successful case is that I managed to change the stance of ACEF, turning them from our opponents, our protesters to our fellows and our supporters.
transcript: 更一个成功的公关案例是，我改变了中华环保联合会的立场，从反对、抗议到理解、支持。

translation: ACEF published a long research report in the form of its internal publication named Led and Guided by Environmental Protection, Paper-Making Can Go Green, in which as a third party, it proved that our company, following closely the industry policies, had taken a path of circular economy.
transcript: 中华环保联合会以它们内刊的形式出版了一期题目叫《生态引领，环保之家，绿色造纸》的长篇的调查报告，以第三方的身份帮我们证明，就说我们的企业是符合产业政策，是走循环经济之路的。

translation: But it was over its top and our public relation efforts had gone too far, attracting strong protests from multiple NGOs of environmental non-governmental organizations(ENGO).
transcript: 但是这件事情动作太大了，就是我的公关有点儿过头了，导致了当时中国多家民间环保组织的强力的抗议。

translation: Liao Xiaoyi, a very famous environmental protectionist back then in China, also the head of Beijing Global Village,  resigned her directorship from ACEF to protest against us.
transcript: 中国有一个非常有名的环保人士叫廖晓义，她是北京地球村的村长，当时就抗议，辞去了中华环保联合会理事的职务。

translation: However, one battle after another, despite all the victories against those NGOs, I wasn’t happy at all.
transcript: 一个一个的战役打下来，每一次面对这些民间环保组织看似胜利的结果，我没有一点点成功的喜悦。

translation: I had been thinking.
transcript: 我在想。

translation: I worked as an environmental public relations specialist in this company, I was well paid and I stayed in 5-star hotels, I went on business trips by plane.
transcript: 我到这个公司里来做环境公关，是我拿工资，我住在五星级酒店，我出差都是坐飞机。

translation: I had a high income.
transcript: 拿着很高的工资。

translation: In contrast, what about those people working for those NGOs?
transcript: 而那些民间环保组织人士呢？

translation: They took the train and sometimes couldn’t afford a sleeper class.
transcript: 他们是坐火车，有时候卧铺都买不起。

translation: They might have to live in the hostels.
transcript: 他们可能住在青年旅舍。

translation: And later I found out that some of them were not paid at all.
transcript: 后来我才知道有一些民间环保人士连工资都没有的。

translation: They volunteered to do all their work.
transcript: 是志愿者。

translation: But why were they so persistent?
transcript: 可是他们又为了什么这么执着？

translation: I asked myself later, for what?
transcript: 后来我想，他们是为了什么？

translation: For themselves?
transcript: 他们是为了他们自己吗？

translation: No, they did all these to protect our environment for all of us, including for me.
transcript: 不是，他是为了我们的生态环境，是为了我们大家也包括我在内。

translation: At the end of 2006, I went back to Hangzhou, my hometown, to gather together with my former classmates.
transcript: 2006年的年底，我要回老家杭州参加同学聚会。

translation: I started out my career as a journalist, and some of my classmates, also journalists, knew that I was enthusiastic about legal rights protection.
transcript: 同学聚会的时候因为我是写新闻出身的，我的同学都是记者，以前知道我是维权英雄。

translation: So when they heard that I was then working as environmental PR in a company like that, they said to me in a joking tone, "Yang Jianchu, how come you turned yourself from a hero of legal rights protection into a traitor?"
transcript: 那一天吃饭听说我在这样一家企业里做环境危机公关，用开玩笑的口吻跟我讲，说：“杨建初，你怎么从维权的英雄变成了汉奸啦？”

translation: I knew it was a joke but it made me feel really bad.
transcript: 虽然是一句玩笑话，我听了以后心里很不是个滋味儿。

translation: I was, just like Jake Sully in Avatar, stuck in the conflict and confusion of the ideal and the reality, of my profession and the morality.
transcript: 那时候我就像《阿凡达》中间的杰克·萨利，陷入了理想和现实，职业和道德的一种矛盾和困惑之中。

translation: What should I do?
transcript: 我该怎么办？

translation: As a professional manager, I was supposed to protect the brand of my company.
transcript: 如果我是个职业经理人，我就应该维护我企业的形象。

translation: But to be honest there were certain things I couldn't talk about.
transcript: 可是有一些事情说实话我真不想说。

translation: So I chose to resign on 22nd, March, 2007.
transcript: 所以2007年的3月22号我选择了辞职。

translation: Thank you!
transcript: 谢谢！

translation: Now I've shifted my role from a PR Manager in a foreign company to an environmental protector.
transcript: 我从一个外资企业的危机公关经理变成一个环保人士。

translation: I used to fight against the ENGOs but now I work with them.
transcript: 我从以前专门跟环保民间组织打交道，现在加入到了他们的行列里面。

translation: Since I became a environmenal protector, I later discovered that in China it was really hard for people to be an ENGO volunteer and It was difficult for grassroot NGOs to get by.
transcript: 自己成为民间环保人士以后才发现，在中国，要做一个民间的环保人士，草根的NGO是非常的艰难，非常的不容易。

translation: I'm not here today to tell you how brave I had been, weathering the risks.
transcript: 今天我不介绍我自己是怎么的勇敢，怎么的冒着风险。

translation: Here I am only to tell you one story that is not so far away from Shanghai.
transcript: 我在这里只讲一个故事，这个故事离我们上海很近。

translation: We all know that Mr. Zhu Ziqing once wrote an essay called "Qin huai River in the Paddle Sound".
transcript: 我们大家都知道朱自清先生有一篇散文叫《灯光桨影里的秦淮河》。

translation: I believe that the Qin huai River at that time was very clean, but you could go check out how the river looks like now.
transcript: 我相信那时候的秦淮河是非常的干净的，可是在座的朋友你们现在去看一看，现在的秦淮河是怎么样子的。

translation: It has become dead water as many enterprises with heavy pollution are situated over there.
transcript: 那是一汪死水，边上有很多的污染企业。

translation: It is reported one day that a paper-making factory named Qinhuai Paper-Making had directly discharged its wastewater into Qinhuai River, without taking any environmental protection measures.
transcript: 那么我们接到举报有一个造纸厂就叫秦淮纸业，经常偷排，不采取任何的环保措施，把造纸的废水直接排到秦淮河里去。

translation: How dreadful!
transcript: 这事情多么可怕！

translation: So we went to investigate.
transcript: 后来我们就去调查。

translation: During our investigation, the local Environmental Protection Department assured us, "No, there is no such thing, we examined regularly. "
transcript: 调查的时候当地的环保局说：“没有哇，我们经常去查。”

translation: The factory also confirmed, "We've never discharged wastewater."
transcript: 厂里也说：“我们从来不偷排。”

translation: At that moment, an old man, who was a former employee of the factory, took off his jacket and jumped into the drains, saying, "I need to say it out even if I die today. Otherwise my children and my grandchildren will die."
transcript: 这个时候，一位曾经在这个工厂上过班的老职工站出来了，他脱下他的外套，跳到了他们的排污池里头，他说：“今天我说了大不了我死，但是我如果不说，我的孩子，我的孙子可能会死。”

translation: He pulled out the drain and we found that there were actually two pipes, one was a proper sewer pipe for inspection from people like us.
transcript: 他把那个排污管扒出来，原来这个厂里的排污管排了两个，一个是迎接检查的，是给我们这些人去查的时候去看的，这个是光明正大的排污管。

translation: And another hidden pipe was used to discharge wastewater secretly without any treatment, hence, no treatment cost.
transcript: 还有一个是暗管，是偷偷地排的，不加任何处理的，没有任何治理成本的。

translation: The old man pulled the sewer pipe out and beans were spilled.
transcript: 这位大爷跳下去以后一拔出来，全部露陷了。

translation: The untreated black wastewater just bursted out.
transcript: 那个黑水没有处理的污水“啪”就出来了。

translation: The man before me asked, "Will the sun rise as usual tomorrow?"
transcript: 前面的老师说：“明天的太阳能不能出来？”

translation: I believe it will.
transcript: 我相信明天的太阳能出来。

translation: But if we don't cherish our environment or our ecosystem, the apocalypse will soon come.
transcript: 但是如果我们不爱护环境，不爱护生态，不久可能世界末日真的要来了。

translation: Something happened in my family in 2010.
transcript: 2010年我自己家里发生了一件事情。

translation: My wife fell ill but it was not a serious illness.
transcript: 我的妻子生了一场病，这个病本来不重。

translation: So she only needed to go through a little surgery.
transcript: 只要动个小手术就可以了。

translation: But to my shock, while she was having the surgery, the operating room was contaminated.
transcript: 谁知道在医院里动手术的时候手术室里面感染了。

translation: I knew the environment outside could be contaminated but never thought the contamination could happen inside an operating room.
transcript: 我真想不到外面环境会污染，竟然医院的手术室也会有污染，也感染了。

translation: The surgeon who operated on my wife went on a business trip to Singapore the next day and didn't return until five days later.
transcript: 动好手术那一天给我妻子动手术那个大夫，第二天就出差去新加坡了，五天以后才回来。

translation: During this period of time, my wife ran a high fever every day and the doctor on duty gave her the best anti-biotics.
transcript: 我妻子天天发高烧，值班医生就给她打最好的抗生素。

translation: When the surgeon returned from Singapore, he immediately had her stitches removed, the inside of which was already purulent and there were adhesions.
transcript: 等到那个主刀医生从新加坡回来以后，马上把她的原来缝好的伤口拆掉，里面已经化脓了，黏连了。

translation: She then had another two surgeries, the second of which resulted in urinary leakage.
transcript: 后来也连续动了两次手术，第二次手术造成了尿漏。

translation: Do you have any idea of what comes to an adult whose urine leaks?
transcript: 你们知道一个成年人尿漏是怎么样的后果？

translation: He/She has to wear adult diapers for half a year.
transcript: 半年时间带一块成人的尿布在身上。

translation: As I witnessed my beautiful wife being tormented by the illness during the three months in hospital, I dreaded that she could at any minute leave me forever.
transcript: 我看着貌美如花的妻子被病魔折成了这个样子，那时我在想，我我陪护我在医院里陪了她三个多月，那时候很怕，很怕我的妻子就这么走啦。

translation: She stayed with me from the age of 21 wherever I went, with no complaints.
transcript: 她21岁就跟着我走南闯北，无怨无悔地跟着我。

translation: So I was really scared at that moment.
transcript: 可是我真的很害怕那时候。

translation: It was during that three months in hospital that I gained more understanding of the environment, health, families and even lives.
transcript: 就在那三个月里头我对人生、对环境、健康、亲情乃至生命，有了更多的思考和感悟。

translation: I want to find a place with fresh air, green mountains and clean water.
transcript: 我想找到一块空气清新，环境优美的山水。

translation: I want my wife and my daughter to live a happy life.
transcript: 我要让我的女儿，让我的妻子过上幸福美满的生活。

translation: So in the second half of 2010 when my wife recovered from the illness, I took her to Anji city of Hangzhou and lived there for a long time.
transcript: 所以2010年的下半年等我妻子大病初愈的时候，我就带着她来到了杭州，去了安吉，在安吉住了很长时间。

translation: In August 2011, the three of us drove from Guangzhou to Changsha, to Zhengzhou, to Beijing, then we passed by Qingdao, Lianyungang, Ganzhou and then went back to Guangzhou.
transcript: 2011年的8月份我们一家三口又从广州开车到长沙，到郑州，到北京，又从北京到青岛，到连云港，到赣州，回广州。

translation: We travelled 6500 miles for 14 days.
transcript: 全程大概6500多公里，走了14天。

translation: In February this year, on 11th of the lunar calendar year, I took my wife to Mount Emei, Sichuan and stayed in Wannian Temple for 3 days.
transcript: 后来今年的2月，农历二月十一，我又带着我的妻子去了四川，在峨眉山上，峨眉山的万年寺里住了三天。

translation: I had been to many places before I met Zhangjiajie.
transcript: 我自己也走了很多地方，直到遇到张家界。

translation: There I was astonished by the mountains and the water of Zhangjiajie.
transcript: 我到张家界以后，我被张家界的山水震撼了。

translation: The concentration of negative oxygen ion in Jinbian Brook reaches around 100,000.
transcript: 金鞭溪的空气负氧离子的含量达到10万左右。

translation: The mountains over there are astonishingly beautiful.
transcript: 那里的山太漂亮了。

translation: Later I thought to myself, this is the Peach Blossom Spring I've been searching for.
transcript: 后来我想这就是我心中的桃花源。

translation: I need to settle down here, right here in Zhangjiajie.
transcript: 我要在这里安家，我要把家安在张家界。

translation: I would like to tell you another story.
transcript: 在这里啊我要再插一个小故事。

translation: When my wife had just recovered, we moved first to Qingyuan, a little town in the suburb of Guangzhou instead of directly to Zhangjiajie.
transcript: 当初刚开始的时候，妻子生病刚生好的时候，我没有在广州我也没马上搬到张家界，我搬到了广州郊区的一个小城市叫清远。

translation: I'm not sure if all of you have heard of this city.
transcript: 我不知道在座的有谁知道。

translation: But the name of this city is very beautiful.
transcript: 这个名字起得非常的美丽。

translation: The name "Qingyuan" reminds me of a clean river that flows afar.
transcript: 叫清远，山水清远的清远。

translation: It's 60 miles from Guangzhou and has the best hot spring and rafting.
transcript: 它离广州六十公里，那里有最好的温泉和漂流。

translation: It used to be the backyard garden of Guangzhou.
transcript: 曾经是广州的后花园。

translation: So originally I thought since the environment and air in Guangzhou weren't that good, I could move to Qingyuan.
transcript: 所以当初我在想，广州环境不好，空气不好，我就把家搬到清远吧。

translation: However, not long after we bought an apartment in Qingyuan, Guangdong government introduced a new policy called "Empty the cage for new birds".
transcript: 谁知道刚刚在清远买了房子，没多久，广东省推行了一个政策叫 “腾笼换鸟”。

translation: "Empty the cage for new birds" means moving some of the heavily polluting companies from the developed areas out to peripheral areas.
transcript: 所谓的“腾笼换鸟”就是把一些经济发达地区的重污染企业搬出来，外移。

translation: Therefore those heavy polluters in Dongguan, Shunde and Foshan all were then moved to Qingyuan.
transcript: 好啦，东莞、顺德、佛山那些污染的企业，这些污染的鸟都搬到清远来了。

translation: So later Qingyuan was surrounded by global waste treatment factory in the south, a cement factory in the north, a porcelain city in east and an electroplating plant in west.
transcript: 所以后后来的清远变成了，南面是洋垃圾处理厂，北面是水泥厂，东面是陶瓷城，西面是电镀业。

translation: I'm telling you this story here because I don't want to see Zhangjiaije become another Qingyuan.
transcript: 那么我讲这个故事是因为我不希望张家界又变成第二个清远。

translation: I wouldn't want to escape from Zhangjiajie later.
transcript: 我不想在张家界再做逃兵。

translation: I've founded the Wulingshan Ecological Environmental Protection Association in Zhangjiajie.
transcript: 我在张家界成立了武陵山生态环境保护联合会。

translation: I want to guard the last piece of clean land and create a better home for not just myself, my family but also more people out there.
transcript: 我希望守好这一块最后的净土，给我自己，给家人，给更多的人创造一个美好的家园。

translation: Many people asked me, "Yang Jianchu, why did you give up your well-paid job in a foreign entreprise and choose to work for environmental protection instead?"
transcript: 很多人问我：“杨建初，你为什么放弃外资企业的高薪不干，做环保了？ ”

translation: My answer is, "I'm born to join the cause of environmental protection. As my mother's name is "water" and my father's is the earth and forest, I'm the son of water, earth and forest!"
transcript: 我说：“我这命中注定要做环保的，因为我的母亲叫水珠，我的爸爸叫土林，我是水、土地和森林的儿子！”

translation: Thank you!
transcript: 谢谢大家！
